borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:14.2pt;text-align:justify;text-autospace:
none"><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">Noise from the non-residential uses hereby
permitted, including, but not limited to, live and amplified music shall be
controlled so as to be inaudible inside adjoining and other noise-sensitive
premises in the vicinity of those uses.&nbsp; The initial test for compliance
with the ‘inaudibility’ criterion will be that noise should be no more than
barely audible outside those noise-sensitive premises.&nbsp; In the event there
is disagreement as to whether such noise is or is not audible the following
numerical limits shall be used to determine compliance with this condition:</span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ascii-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin"><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align:justify;text-autospace:none"><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ascii-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;
color:red;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">&nbsp;</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:14.2pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-14.2pt;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1;text-autospace:none"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:
Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">·<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-optical-sizing: auto; font-feature-settings: normal; font-variation-settings: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><!--[endif]--><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;
font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">the LAeq
(CUAN) shall not exceed LA90 (WCUAN); and<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:14.2pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-14.2pt;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1;text-autospace:none"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:
Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">·<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-optical-sizing: auto; font-feature-settings: normal; font-variation-settings: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><!--[endif]--><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;
font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">the L10
(CUAN) shall not exceed L90 (WCUAN) in any 1/3 octave band between 40Hz and
160Hz.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align:justify;text-autospace:none"><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ascii-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-ansi-language:EN-US">&nbsp;</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:14.2pt;text-align:justify;text-autospace:
none"><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">CUAN = Commercial/Community Use Activity
Noise Level, WCUAN = representative background noise level without
commercial/community use activity noise, both measured 1 metre from the façade
of the noise-sensitive premises.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align:justify;line-height:115%"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">&nbsp;</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:14.2pt;text-align:justify;text-autospace:
none"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ascii-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin">The
combined rating level of the noise from any plant installed pursuant to this
permission (other than plant which is only to be operated in emergency
circumstances) shall not exceed the existing background noise level outside the
window to any noise-sensitive room.&nbsp; Any assessment of compliance in this
regard shall be made according to the methodology and procedures presented in
BS4142:2014.</span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-fareast-language:EN-GB"><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align:justify;text-autospace:none"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ascii-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin">&nbsp;</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:14.2pt;text-align:justify;text-autospace:
none"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ascii-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin">Any
machinery and equipment installed pursuant to this permission shall be designed
and installed to ensure that structure borne (re-radiated) noise emissions
shall not exceed 35 LAeq dB (5 min) when measured in any habitable room in
adjoining residential premises.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-right:19.3pt;text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ascii-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin">&nbsp;</span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:18.0pt;text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-fareast-language:EN-GB">Within 3 months of the date of this
permission an events management plan shall be submitted&nbsp;and approved in
writing by the Local Planning Authority. The events management plan shall
provide details of how the site will operate for functions with more than 30
attendees including details on&nbsp;likely&nbsp;event timetables, event health
and safety statement, key contacts, risk assessment, details of
any&nbsp;security personnel/ stewards, transport management plan and emergency
plan.&nbsp;</span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:18.0pt;text-align:justify;text-autospace:
none"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold">Within 3 months of the date of this application full details of the 7
cycle parking spaces shown on drawing TFK 1902/11 Proposed Block Plan dated
February 2023 shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local
Planning Authority. All cycle parking shall be designed in accordance with the
London Cycle Design Guidance. The approved details shall be implemented and
retained thereafter for the lifetime of the development.</span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:18.0pt;text-align:justify;text-autospace:
none"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold">Within 3 months of the date of this permission the applicant shall provide
evidence to the Local Planning Authority that the internal works shown in
drawing number TFK 1902/07 Proposed Ground Floor Plan dated February 2023 have
been completed. Once completed the internal works shall be retained thereafter
for the lifetime of the development.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align:justify;text-autospace:none"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold">&nbsp;</span></p>
description: Retrospective change of use of the rear part of the ground floor and the first floor to a community centre (Class F2) and place of worship (Class F1) and Proposed alterations to the internal arrangement and external elevations including removal of the first floor plant room

constraints_details.result: The Co-operative Food, 691 Green Lane, Dagenham, Barking And Dagenham, RM8 1UU
